answers.answer: You need to see an endocrinologist (diabetes specialist)But I can tell you that carbohydrates raise BG,  ALL carbs, even whole wheat..... rice, pasta, potato, most fruit.  Its not just sugar.If you get a diatition that says you "have to eat carbs"  ask them if they have herd of "essential Nutrients"   (trust me they have)  Then ask them if I have to have carbs why is it NOT an essential Nutrient?   the answer is simple, you dont have to have them.  your body can make all the BG it needs for your brain without carbs.  carbs are the fastest way to make BG,  but our problem is that we have too much BG so why do we need to eat foods that are the fastest way to make BG.Sorry a little rant.

question: I just got diagnosed diabetic.  I was wondering how to lower my blood glucose?  it averages about 140.  I really want to take good care of myself and possibly stop the complications to this disease.  My husband and I are also trying to get pregnant.  I want tight control.
title: how do I manage my diabetes?
